s.text: Data from each RNA sample size group were exported and each probe set analyzed in the following ways:
[ 10 ] , using only a single round of amplification.

Restricting probe sets to those minimally present (our "detection filter") dramatically decreases the number of false positives, from an average of 56 down to 14, restricting analysis to genes called present in a higher fraction of the arrays from one of the comparison groups could further reduce false positives, but at the cost of missing some true positives.

Therefore, we recommend using the standard protocol instead of using the amplification strategy for samples down to 1 ?g of total RNA, and our simplified amplification protocol for smaller samples, at least down to 0.1 ?g.
